title: Google Sheets Double Click to Fill

metadata.description: Learn about Google Sheets Double Click to Fill with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Introduction
content_sections.content: Google Sheets Double Click to Fill

content_sections.title:
Google Sheets Double Click to Fill

Double Click to Fill
The
fill function
can be
double clicked
to complete formulas in a range
content_sections.content:
:
Note:
For the double click to work it has to see a recognizable pattern.
For example: by using headers, or with the formulas in the columns or rows 
Double Click to Fill Example
Let's use the Double click fill function to calculate the Attack
B2:B20
+ Defense
C2:C20
for the Pokemons in the range
D2:D20
.
Select
D2

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=
Name	Attack	Defense
      Caterpie	30	35
      Metapod	20	55
      Butterfree	45	50
      Weedle	35	30
      Kakuna	25	50
      Beedrill	90	40
      Pidgey	45	40
      Pidgeotto	60	55
      Pidgeot	80	75
      Rattata	56	35
      Raticate	81	60
      Spearow	60	30
      Fearow	90	65
      Ekans	60	44
      Arbok	85	69
      Pikachu	55	40
      Raichu	90	55
      Sandshrew	75	85
      Sandslash	100	110
Copy Values
Select
B2
Type
+
Select
C2
Hit enter
Double click the fill function highlighted by the black rectangle
Way to go!
The function understands the pattern and completes the calculation for
D2:D20
. Note that it stops when there is no more data to calculate, at row
20
.
Note:
The Fill uses the data in nearby columns. If there is an empty column between the data and the destination range, the fill function might not work properly.

★
+1

related_topics.title: C Common Pitfalls and How to Avoid Them

quiz.question: What is Note that it stops when there?
options: an empty column between the data and the destination range
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of Note that it stops when there is 'no more data to calculate'.

quiz.question: What is If there?
options: an empty column between the data and the destination range
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of If there is 'an empty column between the data and the destination range'.

summary: This tutorial covers Google Sheets Double Click to Fill concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Google Sheets Double Click to Fill effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Google Sheets Double Click to Fill and how to apply it in your projects.
